intro: Senecio tichomirovii, commonly known as the Tichomirov's groundsel, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. It features small, daisy-like yellow flowers and has narrow, linear leaves. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
